title.narrative: Component 2: RC Climate Centre

description.narrative: FbF coordination, tools, country-specific protocols and advice from RCCC roll-out, pilots and establishing FbF system in Mali and Zambia

Preparedness action based on existing early warning systems has been instrumental in saving lives and livelihoods. But, whereas early warning systems are proliferating, investment in the SOPs and resources required to act on warning lags behind. RPII will apply FbF. It will set in place a system that automatically triggers action (and immediate release of corresponding funds) based on a forecast, systematically reducing disaster effects in the target areas.
Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement and other stakeholders are familiar with FbF and FbF has been demonstrated and established in several National Societies
Zambia Red Cross, Mali Red C, global

participating-org.narrative: Red Cross / Red Crescent Climate Centre

sector.narrative: Multisector aid for basic social services

title.narrative: Z (inactive) - Disaster response innovation
All innovative concepts have been documented through case studies (use, limitations, viability/business models, roll-out recommendations)

comment.narrative: Documentation through case studies planned for 2018. This is because 2017 was focused on setting the foundation at NS and government leve for FbF implementation Recommendations on roll out and sustainability were developed during the annual meeting 2019
Documentation through case studies planned for 2018. This is because 2017 was focused on setting the foundation at NS and government leve for FbF implementation

title.narrative: A training/orientation manual for FbF developed

comment.narrative: A draft outline on the FbF training kit has been developed. The FbF module been merged into the Climate Training Kit that provides information on Climate Risk Management - https://www.climatecentre.org/training
A draft outline on the FbF training kit has been developed. This is still work in progress

title.narrative: At least 1 step by step guide and worksheet for the selection of actions and forecasts for FbF systems is developed and tested

comment.narrative: National Societies including Bangladesh, Mali and Zambia will test the new FbF methodology. The thematic groups will support the implementation of the FbF methodology and this is work is expected to begin early next year.
The impact based forecast methodology guide and criteria for EAP has been developed and provide guidance on selection of early actions and forecasts

The team used the early actions selection criteria in the FbF manual to guide the selection of early actions. Feedback from the team was that the selection criteria provided is adequate for early actions selection. Based on the guidance on forecast verification provided in the manual, it was recommended to use water levels from WARMA and GloFAS for triggering early action

title.narrative: Conduct applied research on the effectiveness of actions incl. cost benefit analysis

comment.narrative: Planned based on actual trigger or simulation and this will be done in 2020

title.narrative: Identify national or international funding mechanisms that can be used to fund actions when a SOP is triggered.

comment.narrative: Potential national funding mechanisms have been identified in Mali and Zambia and dialogue is ongoing for FbF considerations on the funding streams

Potential national funding mechanisms have been identified in Mali and Zambia and dialogue is ongoing for FbF considerations on the funding streams.Further work will be done in 2020 to identify other potentail funding mechanisms that can be used to fund actions. These will also be presented to government and other stakeholders for consideration

title.narrative: 2 researches are conducted in the 2 selected HNS as part of Forecast scoping & risk analysis to research forecasts and historical disasters in order to identify how likely a disaster is to happen after a specific forecast has been issued.

comment.narrative: Risk analysis will be conducted once the thematic groups start functioning. supported by 510
Risk analysis will be conducted once the thematic groups start functioning.

title.narrative: Two National Societies actively implemented the step-by-step guide on establishment of FbF systems

comment.narrative: The FbF system in Mali is expected to be ready early Jan and the one for Zambia is ready for pilot and was developed based on the impact based forecast model. (Please see attached the narrative description on the system).
The thematic groups in Mali and Zambia have started work on the development of the impact based forecast
Work on the development of the FbF trigger methodology in Mali and Zambia will start in early 2018

title.narrative: At least 2 evaluations are conducted to assess the efficiency and effectiveness of forecast-based action drills and triggers in the 2 selected HNS

comment.narrative: To be done next year. This delayed because it was dependent on the completion and submission of the SOPs/EAP

title.narrative: 2 researches are conducted in 2 selected HNS as part of Action scoping to identify what actions are being taken or can be taken based on forecasts

comment.narrative: A research was conducted to identify actions taken by communities based on forecasts on Zambia. Report is available

title.narrative: At least 2 data base of action examples for different hazards and locations that can be used as an inspiration for FbF actions

comment.narrative: A repository of early actions has been developed and will be updated to include early actions from Mali and Zambia. ZRCS project team has drafted early actions to be presented to SMT for validation. MRCS has drafted a menu of early actions and a prioritization process for Early actions to be included in the EAP is ongoing
IA repository of early actions has been developed and will be updated to include early actions from Mali and Zambia. The early actions groups in each country will lead on this process

IA repository of early actions has been developed and will be updated to include early actions from Mali and Zambia. ZRCS project team has drafted early actions to be presented to SMT for validation. MRCS has drafted a menu of early actions and a prioritization process for Early actions to be included in the EAP is ongoing
In addition to the global data base, Mali and Zambia will develop a data base of actions and this will be included in the EAP.

title.narrative: At least 2 Mapping exercises are conducted to identify relevant existing and potential stakeholders who can support/influence FbF engagement in the 2 selected HNS

comment.narrative: Mapping exercise concluded in the Mali and Zambia
Mapping exercise concluded in the Mali and Zambia

title.narrative: At least 2 priority areas are supported based on results of scoping study

comment.narrative: Both Mali and Zambia met agencies have identified the need for capacity building in the development of models for predicting extreme events. RCCC is supporting WARMA in Zambia in flood forecasting This is included in the FbF system developed for Zambia ( See FbF systen description doc)
Both Mali and Zambia met agencies have identified the need for capacity building in the development of models for predicting extreme events. RCCC is supporting WARMA in Zambia in flood forecasting

title.narrative: Conduct at least 1 FbF scoping study in each of the 2 selected HNS

comment.narrative: Scoping studies concluded in Mali and Zambia

title.narrative: At least 10 members of SMT in each of the 2 selected NHS oriented on developed frameworks and tool kits for FbF

comment.narrative: A one day FbF orientation meeting was held in Mali and a total of 20 participants including MRC Senior Management Team, Brand SGs and 3PNS

A total of 54 staff, volunters , board members and PNS were oriented on FbF. (20 from Mali RC and 34 from ZRCS) A one day FbF orientation meeting was held in Mali and a total of 20 participants including MRC Senior Management Team, Brand SGs and 3PNS
A total of 54 staff, volunters , board members and PNS were oriented on FbF. (20 from Mali RC and 34 from ZRCS)

title.narrative: At least 3 case studies of financial mechanisms that have been used for FBF and their disbursement procedures

comment.narrative: The case studies will be produced within 3 years. One case study was published in 2017.
The case studies will be produced within 3 years. One case study was published in 2017. No case study was published in 2019 as there were no activations reported in 2019

title.narrative: At least 4 sessions are held to disseminate results from the applied research (internally & externally)

comment.narrative: dependent on above

title.narrative: 4 country level dialogue platforms are conducted in the 2 selected HNS to garner commitment for FbF

comment.narrative: 2 country level dialogue platforms have been held so far. One in each country

2 country level dialogue platforms have been held so far. One in each country. 2 country level dialogue platforms have been held so far. One in each country. The remaining 2 dialogues are dependent on the completion and submission of the EAP
One national dialogue meeting was conducted in Mali and Zambia will host its dialogue meeting in the first quarter - 2018

title.narrative: At least 4 planning sessions with NHS on strategy and plan for in country FbF engagements are conducted (2 in Zambia and 2 in Mali)

comment.narrative: A total of 11 sessions were held; 5 in Mali and 6 in Zambia
A total of 13 sessions were held; 5 in Mali and 8 in Zambia 1 Planning session was held with ZRCS for 2018

A total of 13 sessions were held; 5 in Mali and 8 in Zambia 1 Planning session was held with ZRCS for 2018. Virtual support on TWG engagement was provided all through the reporting period in Mali and Zambia

title.narrative: 3 technical working group focusing on Forecasts, EW actions and Finance are formed in each of the 2 selected HNS

comment.narrative: 3 Technical working groups were formed in Mali. Zambia willl form its technical working groups in the first quarter 2018

4 technical groups have been formed; 3 in Mali and 1 in Zambia. Zambia will make a decision on wether the current group performs tasks for all the 3 groups, given that the current trigger group is a government structure
